title: How to Quickly Show the Desktop on a Mac

steps.title: Press Fn + F11.
steps.content: Press Fn + F11 . Doing so will reveal your desktop. Alternatively, you can press âŒ˜ Command + F3 .

steps.title: Place your thumb and first three fingers on the trackpad.
steps.content: Place your thumb and first three fingers on the trackpad. Make sure you've got a window up, such as a browser, to switch to the desktop from.

steps.title: Spread your thumb and three fingers apart.
steps.content: Spread your thumb and three fingers apart. Doing so will reveal your desktop. For a demonstration of the gesture, click on the Apple icon in the top left corner of the menu bar. Click System Preferences . Click the "Trackpad" icon. Click More Gestures . Click on "Show Desktop." An example animation will play on the right side of the window.

steps.title: Click on the Apple icon in the top menu bar.
steps.content: Click on the Apple icon in the top menu bar. If you want to make your own keyboard shortcut for accessing the desktop quickly, simply navigate to the shortcuts menu. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click Mission Control.
steps.content: Click Mission Control . It's on the left side of the window.

steps.title: Click Show Desktop on the right side of the window.
steps.content: Click Show Desktop on the right side of the window.

steps.title: Click it again to highlight the keystroke text.
steps.content: Click it again to highlight the keystroke text.

steps.title: Type in your custom keyboard shortcut.
steps.content: Type in your custom keyboard shortcut. If you're using an "F" function key, you will have to hold down the Fn key to type your command.

steps.title: Click the red "X" button.
steps.content: Click the red "X" button. Your keyboard shortcut will be saved!
